38917988.review:
Bot Vice is a nice straightforward arcade shooter. Your character is limited to horizontal movement along the bottom of the screen while enemies pour in above and rain down attacks aimed in your direction. To aid in your survival are two things - a dodge roll that makes you invulnerable while doing it and various pieces of cover you can duck behind. That cover will eventually be destroyed by enemy gunfire though which encourages players to constantly move around and find opportunities to fire back.

The default weapon you begin every stage with is the infinite use handgun, but shooting the yellow droid dishes out ammo for the bigger guns. Whether it's the spread gun for spewing out multiple bullets at once or the rocket launcher designed for high impact damage there's plenty to play around with and easily switchable at the tap of a button. Knowing when to start using up your ammo reserves is key to getting through the stages, especially when the harder enemies start swarming in.

Bot Vice serves up fast short bursts of entertainment with its 50 levels. Each level can be completed in a couple of minutes when played well but replayability is boosted by aiming to finish missions with full health and/or higher letter ranks for time taken. That and it's just kinda fun to drop into a level and blast all the enemies to pieces. The game also offers a sizeable challenge with various difficulty settings. The campaign also puts you on an overall timer on anything higher than easy for that extra push. This is an area the game does stumble on a bit though, as even on the easy setting some missions can be rather brutal. The boss of the final campaign mission especially feels cheap, almost turning the experience into a bullet hell scenario. Fortunately this is not frequent enough to spoil an otherwise fun game.

还行吧，不错的小游戏，冬促3块钱，挂了差不多4张卡总共1.5块出来，也算喜+1
游戏，方式比较简单，但是操作确实比较难
这游戏介绍页面前面已经写了——强烈建议用手柄
然后游戏开始页面上也写了——赢得人都是用了手柄的。。。。
但是实际上手柄操作也是比较繁琐的
基本上，左右是横向操作，上是掩体躲避
A是射击，B是横滚躲避，X是近距离刀斩面前的敌人和子弹
RB瞄准，LT和LB换武器，大概就这几个操作键
反正是比较的，手残党如我是有点应付不来的
实际上由于操作习惯，X的刀斩总是觉得别扭，而B的横滚实际上又不太好用，因为就没法攻击了
敌人一旦多一点，就很麻烦，因为给你的选择有两种
A策略：站着死扛通过近斩自保然后抓住瞬间反击
B策略：通过横滚左右来回规避然后抓住瞬间反击
然后结果就是
A死法：漏了几个子弹没灭掉被打死了
B死法：站起来的空挡被打死了或者滚到角落里被逼死
然后瞄准也是比较迷的，虽然可以通过瞄准侧向射击但是为啥子弹几乎都打偏呢。。。
总之普通难度下，建议先玩how to play的游戏操作介绍吧
反正游戏操作介绍里都能死几回才能过关的游戏我也没玩过几个
这游戏怎么说呢，+1还可以，但是确实比较虐。。。

38423929.review:
Truly a hidden gem on the steam store.

Bot Vice is a difficult game. But, in turn, the stages are short and almost no time is wasted upon death. You get right back into the stage and go again. It aims for the more arcade approach of death being plentiful, but minimal in its punishment. The controls are very responsive and there is always a solution to just about any situation. If you have reflexes, you can do it.

The presentation is fantastic. Extremely colorful stages with varied enemies to occupy them. Animations are well done and expressive. On top of all that, the soundtrack is just as great. An 80s synth and chiptune inspired soundtrack keeps the energy up throughout the whole game.

Only minor complaints that mostly come down to taste:
-The screen shaking can get very out of hand. With so much going on in the screen, the shaking makes it very difficult to keep track. Fortunately, there are options to tone it down.
-Controls take some getting used to. They're defaulted with movement being on the control stick, but I found the movement works much better on d-pad. Once again, you can edit this in the options.
-Erin's voice is pretty low energy during cutscenes. But, the game's story is very much a background element and I believe you can turn off voices as well as just skip the cutscenes.

I'd recommend this to anyone who loves classic arcade titles, shooting galleries, or anyone who is up for a challenge.

Bom, primeiramente essa é minha primeira análise, então posso ter dificuldade ao me expressar sobre a minha experiência com o jogo.

Aviso dado, agora a análise:

Bot Vice é um jogo bem difícil que lhe da raiva e lhe diverte muito ao mesmo tempo, e tembém é bastante viciante. Seus gráficos são pixelados mas muito bonitos e com cores vivas, e com uma perspectiva aérea que lembra muito o jogo da "navinha" do Atari. A soundtrack do game é incrível! É agradável, e combina muito bem com cada momento do jogo, sendo um momento de ação(no início e final das fases), ou de calmaria, além de muito bonita. Um ponto negativo que tenho que citar é que não recomendo jogar no teclado, pois o jogo a cada fase tende a ficar mais rápido e desafiante, assim sendo bem mais fácil jogar com um joystick. Ah! quase esqueci de citar que o jogo também tem diversos cenários diferentes dando um tom a mais ao jogo, e também vão surgindo novos bosses e adversários a cada fase dificultando ainda mais o jogo. 

Observação(Isso foi editado a análise): Agora sim! Game zerado! Apesar de ser um pouco curto mas MUITO divertido! Estou realmente feliz! Mas ainda não estou satisfeito, então vou tentar platinar!
Quando fiz está análise estava bem no início do jogo e ainda não tinha chegado no primeiro boss principal e no primeiro diálogo, então não sabia que o game tinha história. A história em si é simples e clichê mas é boa, essêncial, e dá um "toque" a mais pro game.

-Gráficos: 10/10
-Ambiente(s): 10/10
-Jogabilidade: 9/10
-Soundtrack(Trilha sonora): 9/10
-Dificuldade: 9/10
-História: 8/10

-Nota final: 10/10 Parabéns aos desenvolvedores por fazer um excelente trabalho com esse jogo maravilhoso, trazendo a tona uma "nostalgia"(entre aspas pois não peguei infelizmente essa geração que tanto gosto, aprecio e respeito por ter só 13 anos :/), e divertindo a mim e a todos que souberam usufruir desse ótimo jogo e também trazendo a tona a dificuldade e essencia dos jogos daquela época, e também pelo jogo ser muito leve e otimizado, rodando até no meu PC hehe :v.

38259569.review:
[h1]NEOGEO感あるレトロ風な骨太ゲームはいかが?[/h1]

なんというか、
インベーダーやギャラクシアンがメチャメチャ進化したらこうなったって感じのゲーム。
このゲームがスクロールできたらショックトルーパーズに近いモノになると思う。

過去にもたまにこのタイプのゲームはあったんだが、マイナーすぎて代表作が出てこないし、タイトルを言ってもわからないと思う。

ドット絵や演出はどこかNEOGEOのタイトルを思い出させる作り。
アイテムを切り替えた時の「ヘヴィマシンガン」などのメタルスラッグのようなボイスと、
ショックトルーパーズのようなローリング感がNEOGEOの撃ちまくりゲーの雰囲気を醸し出している。

画面下で左右にしか動けない巨乳女戦士が、ショット、近接、ローリング(緊急回避)を駆使してターゲットを殲滅すればクリア。
全25面。
イージーとノーマルがあって、アーケード風なので常人にはイージーでも結構難しい。
クリアするとさらにハードが出て来る。
実績にエクストラなんちゃらってあるので、ノーマル以上をクリアすると、何か増えるのかもしれない。
一般ピーポーの私はイージーでお腹いっぱいです。

とことんやり込み要素があるので、一つのゲームをやり込む人には応えてくれるゲームだと思う。
そして実績のほとんどがやり込み要素と制限プレイ(障害物を破壊せずクリア等)なので、ゆるゲーマーは挑戦しようという気すら起きない難易度。
これは骨太なゲームですわ。
主人公のねーちゃんに釣られて戦場へようこそすると、死ぬよ。
おおむね出来はいいのだが、実績に制限プレイをいれるのは勘弁して欲しかった。

ストーリー１周クリア。エクストラステージは途中。
SFCライクなビジュアルと、アーケードライクなゲーム性の固定画面シューティング。
キャラクターデザインなどはロックマンXとかあの辺の雰囲気もある？

ステージは完全固定画面で、出現する敵の全滅orボスの撃破でステージクリアとなる。
感触はSTGだが、プレイヤーは撃つ以外に遮蔽物に隠れる、ドッジローリング、ブレードによる近接攻撃を駆使することになる。既存ゲームで例えるならショックトルーパーズが近いか？

個人的にはキャラデザインもゲームデザインも楽しめたが、難易度は高めで敵の攻撃も引っ切り無しなのでかなり忙しいゲームではある。
また、実績の設定が結構鬼畜めで、実績解除を目標にするとストレスが溜まるかもしれないことは伝えておきたい。
FC、SFCフォロワー系が好きな人向けというよりはアーケードライクなゲームが好みのプレイヤーにおすすめしたい一品。

38143644.review:
This is a fun little arcade-style game in the vein of Cabal. The game doesn't take too long; I beat it in roughly two hours over multiple sessions. It's also a good game to just pick up for 10-20 minutes and put down again since the game saves progress per stage, and each stage is about 1-1.5 minutes if you beat it first try.

Pros:

-Responsive Controls
-Nice, cute 16-bit graphics style
-Lots of action in nice short bursts
-Action is faithful to older arcade games.
-All the weapon power-ups are worth using.
-Harder missions after you beat the game if you think it's too short.
-Cheesy voice acting (this might be a minus for some)

Cons:

-Some enemies don't have good tells for their shots, so it feels like you got hit out of nowhere.
-The aim system is a bit awkward and can sometimes hinder instead of help, especially on mobile enemies.

Overall I'd definitely recommend this game if you like arcade shooters, especially for how cheap it is.

38123495.review:
I really want to like this game, but it has a few issues with early gameplay balance that make it really hard to want to continue.

1)The saber doesn't do enough damage for how rarely you are able to use it. Enemies can rush you for free because your saber is not a threat.
2)Too many guns to switch through for how fast paced and frantic this game wants to be. Especially combined with how much ammo is wasted by the inaccurate "aim" button.
3)The aim button doesn't serve its function well when enemies are constantly moving. It also doesn't target based on distance to the player, but rather on what enemy is closest to the barrier (I THINK, it feels a too inconsistant to analyze).
4)Not enough wind up from enemies. Especially for the early areas. Enemies do not telegraph their attacks enough for the amount of enemies you are expected to keep track of. And enemies who come in attacking right away, such as the jetpack bots, do not give you enough time to realize that they have entered.
5)Bosses bringing minions with them RARELY feels good in ANY game, and this is NOT one of those rare times. It feels especially bad since "aim" never seems to focus on who you'd like it to, and it is a sorely needed tool for bosses that rush right at you and can attack through cover.
6)The cover doesn't feel good enough because enemies are constantly attacking you without telegraph and eventually through the cover.

I'll keep trying to power through it because it's such a neat game idea with designs I'm a fan of, especially the soundtrack, but it's hard to reccomend it without some balance changes. Then again it is REALLY cheap, so I'd still consisder it a good deal purely from content to price ratio. Especially on sale for EVEN CHEAPER.

Nice and short arcade. At first it appears very difficult, but after you master the controls in ~2-3h, it gets a lot easier. It's actually very short game - 50 stages, but at the same time it's pretty cheap, so in my opinion it's worth it's price even without discount.

So, pros:
1) Difficulty is alright, you have to dodge and hide plenty, altho i'd wish for something more challenging like "only HandGun mode".
2) Enemies are diverse, and what's more important, are satisfying to kill. Bosses included ofc.
3) Art is very nice, 16-bit atmoshpere is there for sure.
4) Price is exactly right, not like with many other indie games, which either sell crap for such price, or selling same quality as this game for 3-5x the price.

Sounds and music are good, voices and story are there for the check. It doesn't matter, really, game is not about the story, it's about gameplay.
Also, don't believe that "controller is strongly recommended" sign, I presonally play all games with k/b - and it's totally fine.

And the only con that I can think about - game it too short. 50 stages, half of which you don't even have to complete good, just finish them and you're done. 

So in the end, game is good, especialyl for it's price, altho it could be made a lot more harder and challenging. But for new to the genre people - it's hard enough for sure.

Ever wanted to go back to playing those super hard NES console games? No? Neither did I.
But if someone did, then I would recommend Bot Vice. I remember trying to master the controls for these types of games, and I would spend hours and hours getting better and better, just so I could get a little farther. It was hard to keep the momentum going, because there was so little story. But, we only had a couple games, so onward we pressed in some vain effort trying to complete one more level. The alternative was network television, and that seriously sucked.
Bot Vice is quite a step up from those types of shooters (I am sure they have a name), with buttons to keep aimed while running, for example, but this is still a retro experience, nonetheless. It is quality work, with snazzy music, fun animations, and smooth gameplay. Works perfect on Ubuntu Linux.
If this is your thing, then here you go. But I caution anyone on the fence to check some gameplay videos before purchasing.

Minhas primeiras impressões!
Bot  vice pelo que eu joguei aqui, é mais um jogo com gráficos retrô, que faz lembrar bastante games de SNES. Não são gráficos em 8bits, São de 16bits da Vibe do SNES
O som lembra bastante jogos do Super Nes, Graficos são identico do Super Nes.
 A jogabilidade lembra os  jogos da SNk.
Parabéns aí aos desenvolvedores, fizeram um ótimo jogo por um belo preço, aliado com uma renca de conquista pra gente fazer.

Agora farei a minha análise sobre o game, porque ja finalizei.
Bom,  na minha experiência com o game foi bem positivas. Nesse game tive horas de frustrações, (óbvio,  porque o jogo é bem difícil). Teve fases que foram bem tranquilo, e foi muito show.
A mecânica do jogo é bem preciso, excerto a mira, que tem as vezes que vai pra outro inimigo que eu nem quero atirar. O tiro de fogo achei bem ruinzinho mas, ele é pra ataques curto, dar pra notar isso. Curti muito o sabre, é bem útil quanto vem projetos e etc contra a Enrie. A jogabilidade dos movimento respondem bem.
O enredo é muito bom, é o que mais impressiona e tem voz nas falas, ficou dahora ( não vou citar Spoiler na minha análise! Curti que o jogo custa muito barato e ainda tem legendas em Português, isso todos nós temos que dar credibilidade. As Cgs são muito bem feito, na Vibe dos Animes, só que bem abstrato, mais é bem bonito a arte é isso o que importa.
A dificuldade do jogo, achei bem tranquilo, mas pra quem não tem costume de jogar video game, óbvio vai ser um pouco difícil, mas é questão de si adaptar.
As Musicas são incríveis, uma mistura das trilhas sonora das Tartarugas Ninjas da época dos 16bits e outros jogos da Konami, esta bem feito demais. Os menu quando nós selecionamos modos de jogo ou modificar algo, tem o Sons que lembra do Mega Man Zero X.
Enfim essa minha análise, agora meu prós e contras.



Pros:
1º Belos gráficos em pixel Art, lembrar a experiência gráfica do jogos de Snes, com uma pegada de CD, nos quesito vozes.
2º Tem legendas em português.
3º Bem otimizado
4º não enjoa, level design bem criativo, não chega a ser nenhum Bullet Hell como o pessoal fala por aqui, porque esse pessoal nunca jogou um Aero Fighter da vida.
5º O preço extremamente barato, pouco acima de 4 reais.
6: As Musicas bem Retrô, na Vibe do Snes e afins.

Contras:
1º A mira é um pouco imprecisa, tem as vezes que falha, ( Espero quando tiver Bot Vice 2, arrumei isso por favor). 



Conclusão da Análise
Eu recomendo pra quem nunca jogou. Pra quem não tem costume de jogar um Shorter com uma pegada isometrica, vai passar um pouco de frustração, porque o Bot Vice apesar de ter uma dificuldade regular, mas pra quem é novato, vai passar sufoco.
Obrigado pelo ótimo jogo, espero uma continuação.

37762883.review:
My Review for Bot Vice from DYA Games.

First Kudos to DYA Games for making a really fun game.  I stumbled upon this game while looking through steam and it was on sale too.  This game grab my attention right away, because it gave that nostlagia of mega man x art style with the bullet storm and pixel arcade gameplay.  Which brought back those fond memorys of my youth, when i played those type of games.

Review starting.

Bot Vice is a very fun game, it got the bullet storm feel gameplay which fair waring.  with the art style pixel like mega man x games and with the feel of the arcade gameplay in the mix.  Which the devs made amazing work to this game, it just makes me want to go to a store and play a arcade cabinet.  That how much nostlagia feeling i had when i played this game and it worth every dollar for the price.

Pros & Cons.

Pros+

+Interesting Story: The Story was good, with the added cutscene made it felt you aren't just playing a arcade bullet storm game.

+Gameplay: Gameplay is fun, but challenging as well.  With the mix of adventure style that you can choose the next stage level if you want to continue playing.  Bullet storm, seeing all those bullets coming like a rain shower.  Able to take cover, dodge bullets and beat up bots which one bot appears often to help you.  It gives a heart and many gun weapon choices.  Best one is that split shot, freaking helpful.  

There is also a extra mission mode, i am at this moment still playing those modes to get it all done.  But i did beat the story, only strange thing is i don't know why erin is in different hair color? guessing they forgot.

+Soundtrack: Music is nice, give that action arcade feel to the game.

+Sound Effects: They done good work on the sound effects, it brought that arcade feel to the game.

+Voice Acting:  The Voicing for the characters are done good, but yet in a way it kind of felt that maybe some of the other characters weren't heard well.  Some of the enemy bots, will say stuff but with so much explosion barrels.  It not easy to hear them, that not a negitive to down vote the game.  More of them needing to adjust the sound effects in future games.  As for the actor and actress, Erin voice actress did a good job to her voice.  The same for the actor for the enemy bots and the villain bosses.

+Art Style:  The Art has always look and felt as a mega man x game.  With the retro style to the art from the days of consoles and arcades cabinet look.  It makes me just want to go and make a cabinet custom arcade for my own, just to play this game on there.

Cons-
-Nothing to really complain at all.

So that is it for my review, i personally had a great time playing this game.  It was worth the price, even if i got it for sale it worth it.  Would I recommend this game to a friend, yes if they enjoy the arcade style gameplay.  If you feel that maybe you want to wait for a sale, then wait.  No harm or foul on that.  I bought it on sale but if it wasn't on sale i would have just bought it full price.  It only $1.99 not really going to break the bank.

Hope my review helps others out.  Thanks for reading my review :)

37755475.review:
I don't want to recommend this game. I've not been that frustrated in a very long time. But I completed it, 100%, and by the end, I think I had enough fun that I can't justify not recommending it. It's got so much going for it, but it's miserable sometimes. I constantly felt like I was fighting the mechanics. The dodge roll would go in the wrong direction fairly often. The aiming system was so unintuitive and wonky for me. I felt like you almost always needed it, but sometimes it just screws you over. Missions with challenges to not destroy things made the aiming a nightmare. I kept getting to bosses, wasting all my stuff on nothing, assuming I would still be locked on to them, and then dying. The cover system felt better as I played, but at first it felt like it would have been a lot better to just have cover that you walk behind, rather than having a separate input. This could all just be me, I don't know. The dodge roll going the wrong way certainly didn't feel like it though.

There were a bunch of other little things I kept getting mad about, but I couldn't stop. At one point I was basically just so mad that I felt I had to beat it just to show it who's boss, like I had reverted back to childhood or something, but regardless, I played it to completion. It was a dollar, it clearly has a lot of effort put into it, it's a good challenge, even if some of that challenge felt like the controls working against me. It's good. Play it and go for all of the achievements if you really like to be real upset.

37741845.review:
It's worth saying again, HIDDEN GEM. 

How good is Bot Vice?  It's like...discovering a new favorite shmup game (can I call this a shmup?)...except you went back to 1995 to look for one in an alternate reality where the SNES CD-ROM system released in North America.

Why mention the SNES CD-ROM and not just SNES.  Answer: Voice acting.  Superbly done, too.  It would still have been a great game using just the text, but the voice acting is the icing on the cake.  Also, nobody plays shmups for the story, but the developers threw a fitting one in anyway.  And that's a good thing.  Aside from the solid core gameplay (more on that later), there are so many little extras that make this game. 

This core gameplay is balance between hiding, rolling, and shooting.  The gameplay is definitely fun, but you need a controller for it.  You definitely wouldn't want a keyboard on this one.  I'm using a logitech F310 and it works well for the gameplay.  

I really enjoyed the overall game time limit mechanic too.  Take as long as you want on each level, but you will need to have a cumulative time of under 30 minutes for the game.  This forces you to go back to those first levels and improve on your time using what you learned.  

and it's $0.99 on sale?

Worth it.  In fact, worth it at full price ($1.99).

The replay value is high too.  You are going to want to go back and get A's on all of the levels.  

We need a sequel with co-op...(I hope that ending was a hint that something is in the works!)

37660786.review:
Juego frenético y muy divertido que puede recordar a una versión acelerado del clásico Cabal.

Nuestra protagonista debe enfrentarse a hordas de enemigos en pantallas estáticas a tiro limpio, pudiendo esquivar el fuego enemigo agachándose tras las coberturas que el escenario proporciona o rodando, contando también con una espada laser para el cuerpo a cuerpo o incluso para detener balas. Con un botón fijamos el blanco mas cercano, mientras que sin apretarlo disparamos simplemente en línea recta. El juego se basa mas en el conocimiento de qué tipo de ataque hace cada enemigo que en los propios reflejos, pues sus ataques suelen ser tan rápidos que sin anticipación seguramente no llegará a tiempo nuestra reacción. Los cyborgs hostiles son variados y originales. Como siempre, es un placer contemplar los preciosos graficos pixelados de DYA Games. La música también acompaña bien y la historia, aunque no sería ni necesaria, le da al juego una mayor cohesión.

Pocas pegas pueden ponérsele. Cuesta cogerle el ritmo y posiblemente te atasques bastante en los primeros niveles, pero después de cogerle el truco todo irá bastante rodado. Es un juego con un empaque perfecto. Quizás la mecánica de cambio de armas no se adapta bien a un juego tan alocado que no nos permite pararnos a elegir una, por lo que acabamos pulsando el botón de cambio de arma para gastarlas a lo loco, que también funciona. Un sistema de disparo normal y otro especial o con bombas hubiese encajado mejor y nos permitiria administrar mejor esos disparos especiales. También echo de menos un ranking mundial con los tiempos totales de los jugadores y los corazones usados, ya que la mecánica arcade se presta mucho a ello.

Nada mas que decir. Un juego genial por un precio ajustadísimo.

36655698.review:
This game is short (took about 2 hours to normally finish without doing the extra missions), but also really fun while it lasts.

Pros:
 - Once this game gets going, it's a really fun bullet hell that has just the right level of difficulty.
 - The enemies have fun, varied patterns.
 - Taking cover and rolling feel satisfying.
 - The retro aesthetic looks polished and colorful.
 - Most of the levels have unique achievements that make them feel even more varied. They also have time rankings and hearts to go for if you want to replay them.

Cons:
 - The difficulty curve is a little weird, because getting used to the controls and mechanics takes about half an hour, but it feels really good once you do.
 - The melee attack doesn't do that much damage, and the dodge roll makes it feel obsolete a lot of the time.
 - Switching between weapons feels awkward, and some are a lot more powerful than others.

Definitely a steal for $2

Fantastic SNES styled corridor shoot 'em up. Or would it be considered a caravan style? Either way, the stages can be played in very short bursts and won't last more than a minute or so but boy those minutes get very, very intense. Even at full price the game is packed with a whole set of much harder llevels outside of the (already quite lenghty) campaign to crown a great old school (for real) experience.

There are a few concessions like the lack of a real scoring system but you'll still be pursuing the A ranks and 4 hearts goals, as well as a lot of challenging feats in the shape of achievements.

Special mention to the graphics and music, the former being almost a cal back to Sparkster/Rocket Knight Adventures but with a cool biomechanical style of its own, combined with awesome synths worthy of the early PSX Capcom and SEGA eras. By adding a more modern touch with the voice acting (which turns out to be fairly good actually, with each character having a distinct voice), the presentation is very sleek.

Very recommended and if you see this on sale, don't hesitate to pick it up! Just beware, it's tough as nails and you'll be crushed a lot under the pressure of the timer or the bullets. Simply use cover and return fire with extreme prejudice and firepower!

36074606.review:
Bot Vice à tout pour plaire:

C'est un jeu au gameplay "simple" (oui, entre guillemets parce que le jeu, lui, est assez difficile et tant mieux) mais prenant. Des vagues d'ennemis arrivent par pack de demi-douzaines et le but, ici, à la surprise générale, c'est de tuer un maximum d'ennemis le plus vite possible à l'aide de l'arsenal qui nous est fourni. De plus, il n'y a non pas un, ni deux mais bien 3 façons de dodger les attaques ennemies et beaucoup plus de façons différentes de jouer. 

Il y a un niveau de scoring qui pousse le joueur à aller le plus rapidement possible et à essayer de finir chaque niveau avec les points de vie au max (c'est un détail mais ça rend assez rapidement addict).

En ce qui concerne les sprites, c'est beau, pas très détaillé mais juste assez pour faire plaisir à la rétine. Il y a pas mal d'ennemis différents et donc, autant de techniques à adopter afin de survivre dans ce monde de brute dans lequel vous n'êtes clairment pas le bienvenu. Quasiment chaque objet présent sur les maps sont destructibles, de quoi faire rougir Michael Bay.

Bref, avec les quelques heures passées dessus, je pense pouvoir déjà affirmer que le gamedesign est jouissif au possible, tout est bien pensé et que, sincèrement, passer à côté, vu son très bon rapport qualité/prix, ça serait une erreur.

Bot Vice est un nouveau très bon jeu de DYA Games. Un shoot'em up nerveux et bien arcade, difficile mais pas trop une fois le coup de main pris (attention, au début le jeu va vous malmener !).

Les graphismes sont excellents, encore une fois, la musique colle parfaitement à l'ambiance, et le gameplay est précis et bien rodé. L'esquive et la possibilité de se mettre à couvert permet de se protéger des hordes de tirs auquel le joueur doit faire face.

+ 25 missions suivies de versions plus corsées de ces niveaux
+ Shoot'em up original avec le système de couverture
+ Armes bien intégrées et bien différentes
+ Graphismes excellents
+ Bestiaire varié

- Peut se réveler être exigeant à maîtriser au premier abord (mais rien d'insurmontable en Normal)
- Légère répétivité vers la fin du jeu

Résumé : Bot Vice a un contenu plus que correct, une difficulté maîtrisée (et maîtrisable), un excellent gameplay et des superbes graphismes en pixel art. A essayer sans attendre !

35203517.review:
Великолепный ардкадный шутер.
Отличная пиксельная графика. Саундтрек поддерживает атмосферу сражений хорошо.
Есть в этой игре даже сюжет с намеком на продолжение.
Но сюжет в таких играх не главное. Главное геймплей.
И тут все очень хорошо. Здесь нет ничего лишнего никаких прокачек персонажа, ничего такого.
Есть вы и ваши противники. По сути это классический ардканый тир. Можно стрелять прямо, стрелять завхватив цель, есть уворот в виде кувырка в сторону. Так же можно прятаться за укрытия, которые тут разрушаемы. Есть удар рукой для поражения ближних противников. Есть несколько типов оружия, которые мы можем перелкючать кнопкой. В игре приличное количество различных врагов, некоторых лучше и быстрей убивать определенным типом оружия. так что тактика какая-то все таки прослеживается.  В принципе все. Но большего и не нужно. Т.к. динамика у игра довольно хорошая. Особенно ближе к концу. Пукан будет гореть точно.. На последнего босса я потратил что-то около полутора часа. При том что убивается он за пару минут))) а подохнуть можно и за 30 секунд в полне, при корявых пальцах) Жизни бесконечные, есть только время за которое надо уложиться вот и все. Есть различные уровни сложности, так что любители хардкора найдут для себя тут чем заняться. в игре 25 уровней, которые надо пройти за отведенное время, что будет подталкивать вас идти на риск чтобы уложиться во время. так что отсиживаться за барикадами тут особо некогда.
В целом действительно качественный шутер. У которого есть свое лицо. Который не даст заскучать вечероком после работы или во время поездки как в моем случае. Владельцы GPD Win могут наслаждаться в дороге вполне комфортно. Девайс прекрасно тянет эту игру.
В общем по хорошему игра на твердую десяточку. Мне зашла очень хорошо.
Птички в игре. да вы будете любить их каждый раз, когда они появляются)))))))

35193093.review:
i dont typically write reviews for games, but whenever I see game made by basically one person that is this fun, I gotta give em props. I am a sucker for old school games, But I hate people who think nostalgia alone is enough to act as a hook. That is not the case with Bot vice. The game does a good job of making fun of old school games and the corny stories that they follow, while also making the game adicting and fun! If you make a light parody/homage type game, this is the way to do it.

Next off lets talk about the game play. This game does a great job of establishing all of the controls and power ups from the very beginning as well as the maneuvers. The controls are simple and tight and the game plays like a cross between Sin and Punishment, and  Wild Guns (not a bad combination at all!). My only real gripe is that I wish that there were more guns ! I don't need like 20+ but maybe 3-4 more would do it for me. 

Moving on I will cover  the games look and design. I love the variety of bot designs and bosses, They are nicely animated and have a vibrant appeal to them. The baddies also have an array of attack styles that make you have to adapt accordingly, usually by waiting for an opening (Snake bot I'm looking at you!) The satges also are beautifuly designed! each of the stages look unique and have interesting gimicks that can add to the mayhem, such as trains ramming through the stages, armored trucks launching bombs every where.or even Robot trash bugs chasing  you out of trash cans! 

My final talking point is music. I love video game music and music and general so For me a games soundtrack appeal is crucial to my desire to want to play a game. I believe that A games soundtrack should enhchance and support the overall game. This game nails it! I love the Megaman and TMNT esque soundtrack that this game delivers! the 80's and 90's synth fit the homage style and each stage has it;s own theme! No reused songs except for the bosses at the end of the main levels, but each boss specific stage has their own high octane but kickin background theme! I only wish that the Music was dlc :D

My only real gripes are that I wish there was more guns , that there were a co op, and that the game innovated a little buit more in establishing its own Identity. but judging by the ending, I am sure we will see more from the creators one day! and I look forward to it! Get this game if you like frantic high octane shootouts and a cast of corny quote spewing enemies with laughable voices!  For a Arcade game 8/10

Also when you beat the game be sure to check out the extras, because the fun truly begins there ;)

33953074.review:
Sigh...you know, I bought this game on a steam sale and didn't play it until months later.  The hell was I thinking?!  This game, and by extension DYA, their studio, is an excellent arcade machine.  This is a nice Wild guns style game where you are moving and shooting things on a single screen.  Kill enemies until the boss appears, then destroy them.  Rinse repeat.  The game is fast paced and when you die, which you will, it restarts instantly, never having you fall into a lull with no action.  You have plenty of weapons and chances to use them and it's engrossing in short spurts.

That's the key.  This is an arcade game and in short spurts, it's excellent, fun, and has a surprisingly fun story.  DYA goes all in with all its games with voice acting and storytelling which, love it or not, is pretty impressive.  This is a fun 30 minute to an hour game that you play, put down, then play again later for a rush.  It's not long, but it is fun and defines, for me, retro done well.

If you want immersive, beautiful storytelling and design, go for Supergiant.  If you want charming narrative with a dark, witty world, go to Failbetter.  If you want a spectacular arcade game, go to DYA.

I really enjoyed this game. The frantic style of the game reminds me a bit of Wild Guns though that is not comepletly accurate. Unlike Wild Guns you have a melee attack (that can also stop some projectiles) a dodge roll and a cover system. 

Enemies come at you relentlessly but the game isn't unfair and slowly introduces new enemy types throughout the levels. You WILL die in this game (even on Normal mode) but that is ok. You have 30 ingame minutes to beat all the stages or you will get a game over. It isn't impossible to do your first run. I managed to do it on my first normal mode run. I recommend playing either on normal or easy on your first run of the game. 

The presentation is pretty damn good! Some of the voice acting can be a little hit or miss but it is pretty good. Erin's actress is pretty good though some of her lines were a bit flat. The final bosses voice made me laugh (I think that was on purpose)

I would love to see a sequel that expands on this or a DLC update. I recommend this game if your looking for a frantic arcade shooter.

ドット絵のカベールシューティング。ゲームのノリとしては、メガドラの『Gunstar Heroes』（実はSteamでも売ってる）に近いと個人的には思った。（他のレビューでは、『ガンスタ』、『ワイルドガンズ』、『メタスラ』あたりを比較に挙げていますね。でも自分は『ガンスタ』が一番近いと思う。）毎ステージにボスが出てくるけど、1面ごとに区切りがあるので、『Alien Soldier』（これもSteamで売ってる）ほど厳しくはなく、単に嬉しいだけである。コントローラー推奨で、自分はサターン風パッドでプレイしたけど、ゲームのイントロ画面でスーファミ風パッドが出てきたので、おそらくスーファミ風パッドが一番プレイしやすいと思う。

1面からえらい難しく思ったけど、最後まで難易度はそれほど変わらなかったので、2面まで普通にクリアできるようになれば、後は楽だった。2面クリアまで1時間か2時間は死ねる。死んで覚えるのが良いゲームである。回復アイテムと高火力アイテムがかなり出てくるので、最終的に、敵の攻撃を避けて打つ「頭脳プレイ」よりも、ダメージを食らいながらでも3wayや火炎放射器などの高火力の武器でザコを薙ぎ払ったりボスを瞬殺したりする「ごり押しプレイ」の方が楽に手早くクリアできるというのが、解ってるゲームバランスである。初回の通しプレイでは、自分はラスボスまでcover（遮蔽物に隠れる）コマンドは全く使わなかった。

エクストラステージでは、硬い敵がいくつも出てくるので、硬い敵が出てくる位置にスタンバって高火力武器で即破壊、という東亜シューのような覚えプレイが要求されるようになる。また、実績解除のためには、避ける、隠れる、オブジェクトに弾を当てない、の頭脳プレイが要求されるようになる。この辺りの玄人好みの戦略を、クリアまでに必須とするのではなく、クリア後のお楽しみにしたのは、解ってるゲームバランスである。

全実績解除まで13時間。通しクリア（全25面）までが7時間くらいで、実績を意識しなければ、単にクリアするだけならもう少し短い時間でクリアできたと思う。他のレビューだと、早い方では2時間で通しクリアしている人もいて、せっかくの面白いゲームでそれはちょっともったいない。自分は2時間かけてやっと2面クリアだから、他の人もそのくらい死ぬべきだと思う。

敢えて言うなら、デモシーンが長いのが気になったところで、早く面をプレイしたいけど、せっかく作ったデモシーンを飛ばすのも悪いし、ねぇ。

 I want to play sequels.

33069128.review:
WARNING! These are initial impressions. Opinion subject to change (though at this point I highly doubt it).
This game is a bullet hell through and through, merciless at every turn. While enemies in the levels are static, their attacks are absolutely not. Everything is aiming at you. Figuring out how to avoid their attacks is an absolute necessity in this game. From time to time in each level a robot will fly around; you can shoot it to get your weapon powerups and one of your four hearts back. These are not only key to your success, their timely distribution is a large part of what makes this game challenging and fun to play- they come in at set intervals, give you set powerups, and if you're not paying attention you'll burn right through their usefulness without doing anything. The biggest thing to note about this game is that you are constricted to a 2D axis of movement (left and right), but your aiming can lock on, allowing for a much greater complexity of attack.

Which brings me to my biggest (and pretty much only) complaint I have with the game. The lock on feature is a very awkward beast to get a hold of- it may not always lock onto the enemy you want, though it is generally fairly predictable given you take the time to position yourself correctly. Locking on is confined to a single button, and you cannot select what it will lock on to, only influnence that by moving closer to/more directly in front of the enemy you wish to target. It's does automatically start targeting the next enemy, though enemies will often bunch up in levels to make themselves harder to hit. As you can imagine this makes chaining lock-ons just a bit awkward. Locking on (like almost everything else in this game) is not instant and so in general by the time you've reacquired your enemy you've likely lost some health. It's not impossible to mitigate, just quite frustrating in parts.

That being said, the rest of the game's mechanics are designed in an extremely intelligent fashion. You generally have three options outside of normal movement to avoid projecties- you can slash at them when they're in range of your saber, you can press up against the barricade (provided enemies haven't destroyed it), or you can roll out of the way (invulnerable to attacks during it). All of these have weight and consequence. The same goes for switching weapons- each enemy has a different resistance to each type of weapon, though a few well-aimed shots from your default weapon will generally make paste of whatever you aim it at, unless it's big and bulky or a boss enemy. None of the powerups works well against all enemies, and your default gun can only ever hit one thing at time, so switching your powerups are essential to finishing the level. It all forces split-second decisions and hairpin timing- this game has a ridiculously high difficulty curve until you learn the levels and enemy patterns.

Lock-on system issues aside, this is absolutely a solid game and I couldn't recommend it enough to fans of shmups and bullet hells.

Bot Vice hits all the right 90's arcade vibes. The gameplay is fast-paced, varied and strategic, with a 25-level campaign as well as a ton of side missions for replayability. Difficulty levels are togglable, which makes it easier to get into while still allowing experts to challenge themselves. What might make things a little difficult for new players is the complex control scheme, which does have a bit of a learning curve to properly utilize. Once you do understand it, the game's a blast. I'd recommend going into the options menu and customizing your controls to find out what layout works for you.

My only complaint about the game is that the cutscenes are long, boring as hell, and have cringeworthy acting. Most of them are skippable, but ending cutscenes unfortunately are not. On the flipside, the spritework and music are both fantastic.

I bought this while it was on sale, but if it was full price I would still recommend it.

30582175.review:
The more I play this game, the more I enjoy it.  Make no mistake, this is old school gaming at its core.  Meaning no mercy.  You learn through your many mistakes.  And somehow you get better.  You finally beat the game.  But you look back and think you can do better.  So you play it again, hoping to get even better.

For the love of god, use a controller.  Friends don't let friends use keyboard for this game.  That being said, the controls take some time getting used to.  You will probably be spending a good amount of time stumbling with the controls before it feels right, however long it takes.  Targetting will always feel somewhat off, but somehow, like everything else in the game, it somehow works out.

I strongly recommend starting on Easy.  Even then the game can be very challenging and may take you some time to get through all the levels.  If you are feeling adventerous, you could always start on Normal.  But you are going to rely on the health pickups a lot.  Maybe you want to do the extra stuff later.  And maybe you can take on Hard mode when you get get skilled enough.

That being said, I have been enjoying this game a ton.  It feels nice to be able to jump into a game without any handholding so I can shoot a lot of things and blow them up.  Taking on waves of enemies is always a thrill, and the boss fights really make you work hard to win.  It's the sort of hardcore gaming fix I needed.  Enough for me to start speedrunning it.

As a speedrun, this game has been downright amazing.  Being forced to play against the clock and learning to be efficient with your weapons makes this game so great to play at a high skill level.  Even not speedrunning it, just getting good at the game feels rewarding.

Have I mentioned how much I love the soundtrack for this game?  These tracks are so freaken good.  Also I'm digging the visual style for this game.  The story and dialogue are forgettable, but I didn't really pay much attention to either.  I was too busy dodge rolling and shooting.

I'm glad I came across this game on Steam and would recommend playing it.

操作：上手贼简单，打法贼粗暴，啥都不用说，谁来谁被戳，啥都不用唠，敌人随便爆，上去就是干，爽暴杀虐感。在操作上没有对玩家有丝毫的为难，没有前摇，没有后摇，没有硬直，随时锁定，随时翻滚闪避，随时躲入掩体，随时甩出激光剑帅气砍暴敌人飞来的子弹，没有任何束缚，你只需要畅怀射杀。

画面：即使像素风格，场景刻画精美，细节毫无懈怠，色彩亮丽鲜明，动作精致流畅，战场全程爆炸迸火光，漫山遍野对扔子弹雨

音乐：全程高潮，25关每一关BGM都不一样，全部都是90年代街机质感力量摇滚电子风，节奏爆棚，复古激荡，游戏介绍里那个OST网站就可以在线试听，写作业时听，语文写错字，数学算错题，睡觉时候听，失眠到天亮。

难度：剧情关难度适中，老少咸宜，挑战项目（既成就）除了全A级评价过关之类的经典成就外，都是要你在某一关达成某种条件后过关（比如不要打爆路边某辆车，不要被这关的激光扫中，不要被地上的毒气呛到之类的），相当具有挑战性。而通关后的追加关难度更加惊人，敌人更多更疯狂，子弹更嗨，场面更爆炸，杀虐更爽快，挑战性飙升。

总结：感谢steam的推荐，我差点错过了这么爽快的游戏，大家别犹豫，买买买，花不出去的钱是无法给你带来快乐的！

26424350.review:
Bot Vice относится к редкому в наше время представителю жанра тиров - конкретно подвиду так называемых Cabal shooters (по аналогии с rogue-like поджанр носит имя игры, первой представившей подобную концепцию). Лично мне игра очень напомнила Wild Guns со SNES, хотя и сам разработчик в описании также приводит данное сравнение. Так что, видимо, Wild Guns был идейным вдохновителем Bot Vice.

Игроку предстоит взять управление над Эрин Сейвер - бывшей полицейской, служба которой подошла к концу, когда она угодила в засаду на одном из заданий и лишилась правой руки, а также потеряла напарника. Рука была заменена современным кибернетическим протезом, но по какой-то причине Эрин не вернулась к службе. Проходит ли она период реабилитация или же решила уволиться - неясно. Однако рука, судя по всему, прижалась неплохо, так как в начальной заставке героиня весело наяривает в игрушку на геймпаде, судя по всему предыдущую игру разработчика - Super Star Path. И в момент триумфа, когда Эрин наконец-то удаётся завалить последнего босса, её, даже не дав сохраниться, беспардонно прерывает некое сообщение, адресованное всем горожанам (никак играла героиня через облачный сервис). Некий Лунатик заявляет, что собирается разрушить Томинака Плаза - главный символ Бот Сити, - если ему не выплатят колоссальную сумму денег. Лунатик также предупреждает, что пытающимся оказать сопротивление придётся столкнуться с Вайлд Ботами. Если угодно - одичавшими, то есть вышедшими из под контроля и отринувшими три главных принципа робототехники, роботами... ну, технически - киборгами. Эрин узнаёт в помощниках Лунатика своих обидчиков, которые убили её коллегу и отправили саму Сейвер на больничную койку. Так что героиня решает совместить приятное с полезным - спасти от разрушения Томинака Плаза, а заодно и отомстить своим обидчикам.

26421827.review:
A short frantic arcade game that reminds me of SNK games like Metal Slug, or Treasure games such as Astro Boy: Omega Factor or Gun Star Heroes or new-ish indie games such as Noitu Love 2 Devolution.



It's a shooting gallery type of game where you need to keep on your toes constantly. It offers 25 stages with boss battles every 5 stages or so.

It's really good but hard. I needed to play on easy mode to even get a chance, Now that I'm more familiar with the controls, I'll give it another go on normal.

The main downside is the voice acting. It's not horrible, I quite liked the voice actress of the main character but I think the game would've been better without it. The story is also nothing to write home about. It's kindof self-aware. I think the game maybe would've been better with a simpler, shorter story?

Some more feedback for the developers:



- Adding an easy mode was a good idea. I know it doesn't exactly fit with your vision, but some people like to enjoy the game at their own pace. If you didn't add one, I probably would've cheated to get the experience I want.
- Add a way to reset controller options to default
- Maybe add cosmetic stuff like unlockable costumes for the main character after completing the game
- Yay, post credits scenes are awesome.
- I really didn't like the voice of Dr. Octipus
- I'm not sure if I entirely like the way weapon cycling works. Not sure how I'd change it. Maybe automatically change to a new weapon on pickup? Maybe only go back to your pea shooter after you exhausted all options? Shortcuts for every weapon? The way I used the weapons now is just go through them one for one, till they run out.

Looking forward to your next game!

25293341.review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hrqDLlR2DTs

La acción es, probablemente, el género que más ha intentado innovar a lo largo de los tiempos, quizá porque es de los más llamativos que existen en los videojuegos. En este ambiente de innovación el meternos en medio del meollo siempre ha sido una obsesión, algo que comenzamos a sorprendernos gracias a la primera persona de títulos como Operation Wolf o a la tercera persona de juegos como G.I. Joe. 

Pero, entre estos dos, hubo un subgénero muy pequeño, que popularizó el famoso Cabal, un juego tan popular, que todos los que intentaron copiar su estilo acabaron etiquetados como “clones de Cabal”, a pesar de que la propia compañía acabaría haciendo uno de ellos: Blood Bros., una secuela que mezclaba elementos del oeste con imaginarios, y del que más tarde otro “clon de Cabal” se inspiró para crear Wild Guns en Super Nintendo.

Basado en estos títulos llega la última obra de los españoles de DYA Games, un heredero directo no solo de estos juegos que os he comentado sino, sobre todo, del espíritu arcade que corría con tantísima fuerza a principios de los 90.

Como dice la propia publicidad, Bot Vice es “Jugabilidad pura y dura. Sin relleno”. Y vaya si lo es. Es duro, rápido y no deja ni un segundo de descanso. Vamos, que vais a sudar tinta. Mucho. 

De hecho, tengo que confesaros que todo el análisis que vais a ver a partir de ahora está grabado en fácil. Eh, eh, que aunque facilita UN POCO el juego, creo que el espíritu de lucha y superación sigue estando ahí: completar las fases no debería costarte más de un minuto, y sin embargo pasarás 10, 20, 30 o incluso un par de horas para terminar algunas de las pantallas. Tanto te metes que, de repente, algunas las completas al primer o segundo intento: no es que sean más fáciles, es que tu eres mejor jugando. 

Pero, y esto es lo importante, la dificultad no es, para nada, un lastre: siempre vas con el impulso de “un intento más”, “un intento más”, porque sabes que no has muerto porque el juego quiera, sino porque tú has fallado. Tienes claro qué es lo que te ha matado y por qué ha ocurrido. Y eso es lo más difícil de lograr en un videojuego.

Vale, pero… ¿De qué va Bot Vice? Bueno, hay una invasión de robots, han pedido un rescate enorme y la prota no se está por muchas ostias. Así que, a tiro limpio, va vaciando de enemigos cada una de las 25 áreas del juego lo más rápido posible. Y digo rápido porque si la suma de tiempo supera cierta cantidad, la fase final es inaccesible. Para solucionarlo, podemos rejugar cualquiera de las pantallas anteriores para mejorar nuestro tiempo.

A pesar de que parece sencillo, el control es muy completo y necesita de un tiempo para que nos acostumbremos: podemos elegir entre 5 armas diferentes, rodar por el suelo, cubrirnos contra las paredes, golpear con nuestro brazo mecánico, apuntar a enemigos o disparar en línea recta. TODO esto EXIGE que consigamos dominarlo a la perfección, o estaremos fritos en segundos. Y se traduce en una experiencia agotadora, pero inmensamente satisfactoria.

¿Tienes un mal día en el trabajo? Revienta coches.
¿Tienes un mal día en casa? Revienta trenes.
¿Tienes un mal día en general? Revienta helicopteros de guerra.

Y, caray, que todo esto viene acompañado de un apartado técnico brillante. Hemos visto muchos juegos con estética de los 90, pero pocos lo han sabido adaptar de una manera tan perfecta: la relación de tamaño de los sprites respecto al escenario, la velocidad y movimiento de estos, las animaciones hechas a mano, la respuesta de los mandos, el parpadeo de los elementos destruibles, las voces digitalizadas durante la acción, la paleta de color elegida, la música sintetizada a manos de sueco Dominic Ninmark… Incluso la dificultad me parece remarcable. 

Sí, la dificultad. Porque me habréis oído quejarme en otra serie de este canal, Va de Retro, que algunos juegos de Super Nintendo me parecían fáciles. Este juego no lo es. Es un heredero directo de las recreativas de la época, solo que aquí no pierdes dinero. Y aunque en un principio piensas: ¿por qué no han comenzado con algo más asequible para luego subir la dificultad? Bueno, es que cada fase presenta algún reto nuevo y lo hace bien, una clase de diseño ante la que me quito el sombrero.

No todo es perfecto y hay un par de detalles que no me gustan. Por ejemplo, mientras que las voces quedan muy bien durante la partida, en las escenas antes de los jefes son un poco… meh. De hecho, creo que tiene demasiada historia para ser un shooter. Aunque, eso sí, esto nos brinda la oportunidad de ver aún más pixel art de muy buena calidad.

Otra cosa que me resulta problemática es que, en ocasiones, la mira cambia de objetivo y esto me puede dejar vendido. No se muy bien como funciona porque muchas veces se queda bloqueada en un enemigo aunque se aleje a la otra punta del escenario, y otras cambia por enemigos que están más lejos que nuestro objetivo deseado. En las fases normales no es mucha molestia, al fin y al cabo todo debe eliminarse, pero contra los enemigos finales puede llegar a incordiar mucho, no pudiendo centrar el fuego contra el jefe y teniendo que acabar de vez en cuando con escoria que ha venido a molestar.

Entonces, ¿qué es Bot Vice? Una manera de que sepáis cómo nos sentíamos los jugadores de finales de los 80 y principios de los 90 en los salones recreativos, cuando nos volvían locos los disparos, las explosiones, los colores chillones y la superación de retos imposibles. Un viaje en el tiempo que reproduce, casi perfectamente, los cabreos, las desesperaciones y las alegrías que nos daban estos títulos. Bot Vice es el juego que soñaba con tener para mi Super Nintendo. Y, por todo esto, creo que Bot Vice merece la pena.

25027682.review: Bot Vice is a prime example of why I love indie games. It's one of those games where I wish it was my idea as its gameplay philosophy resonates with me. You'll love it if you're a huge fan of Wild Guns, Time Crisis, pixels, arcade style gameplay, simplicity with complexity, and awesome synth-rock 90's inspired soundtracks. I don't even mind dying as the music is catchy. I personally love the fact that this game treats me like I've been playing video games for the past 25+ years and is incredibly difficult right off the bat. It's super rewarding when you've got a good flow going using ALL of your abilities and your reflexes are on point. Mashing handgun, dodge rolling, constantly switching weapons depending on the scenario/strategy, blocking bullets with my sword, and carefully timing enemy patterns at a super fast pace. Mentally exhausting, but very fun. This game is one of a kind and I commend the developers for sticking to their game design philosophy instead of catering to the majority. I understand exactly what these developers were aiming for and it clicks with me. Some might complain about the controls. They are certainly different and have a learning curve, but they are excellent. It will take some time to get used to them, but you'll realize you only have yourself to blame when you lose. Sometimes it can add to a game by making the controls something to master. There's a big difference between "bad controls" and great controls that just have a learning curve like Bot Vice. Therefore, I'd disregard any complaints about controls. I wish this game received more attention, but its difficulty might only reach a very niche market. Bot Vice is easily one of my top games of 2016.

24819912.review:
**Check out a video of the game in action for yourself at:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EcVguleSb_U

Bot Vice is a fine, action packed indie game from "Dya Games", a relatively new group, but a good one nonetheless! The game is inspired by "games of yesteryear"...more specifically, games of the 90s (some may think it reminds them of SNES, others may think of 90s arcade games) like Wild Guns and Time Crisis. Dya Games also has another game worth checking out, titled "Super Star Path", a sort of shooting game and puzzle fusion.

At any rate, I will say one thing right now...this game is "hard"...VERY "HARD"...why do I say "hard" the way I do? Well, to be perfectly honest, I love the difficulty of the game and I am actually used to challenging games, even making videos years okay of how to beat every stage in a game like the SNES version of "Jim Powers" (if you look up the game, it is supposed to be notoriously hard) without losing a single life. Yeeeeeeeeah...so I welcomed the challenge and when sitting down and playing this game, I can see why many would have a problem with it; the difficulty hits hard, right from the start...but honestly, after about 15-30 minutes of practice, I really had no problem for most of the game and could see that the game was difficult, but definitely fair...it doesn't have a ton of "cheap" deaths like something like "I Wanna Be The Guy", lol...but like the aforementioned game, or any game that is challenging (but worth playing), you kinda should WANT to practice...I know if I play a fighting game, I don't expect it to be easy; I just practice...I don't see why a game like this should be treated any differently and once you get the cover and roll system down and know to use the targeting system to shoot around obstacles, the game becomes just like my beloved games of old; full of non-stop action, neat visuals, and awesome music!

You control the 28 year old Erin Saver, who lost her partner and one of her arms years ago...now, with a new bionic arm, she is getting revenge and serving justice at the same time to the corrupt and criminal wildbots! Can you beat the 25 levels and protect Tominaka Plaza and get rid of the threat? Well, there are a few more things you should know...to start, the game has "time" and you can't beat all the stages if you do not have enough time. You can replay stages to get a lower time, which will give you more time for your "overall time" and about a "B" or "C" rank on all stages will allow you to have access to the final levels. As mentioned before, you can take cover (duck behind) objects to stay safe, or you can roll to evade fire. Enemies can destroy your "walls" and if they destroy a spot, that is one less spot that you will be able to take cover, which means you would have to roll to dodge. If enemies get close enough, you can cut them down with Erin's mighty saber attack (which can stop some enemy attacks/destroy bullets), but be careful as they might shoot you...study enemy firing habits. 

Enemies will sometimes lob things OVER your wall, so you can't avoid those attacks by covering; you'd have to roll. There is a little guy that moves around and won't attack...shooting the little guy will award you with power-ups! You have your standard shot, a machine gun (super rapid shots!), a flamethrower (short range, but powerful), a spread shot (good for waves), Rocket Launcher (the explosion around the rocket will hit other nearby things and objects...careful not to use this while enemies are close, because you will damage your cover areas), and a powerful grenade, that you can lob over enemy obstacles!

The game was updated with an "Easy" mode where you can get life recovery items and you can play with keyboard and joystick (my joystick is generic though and didn't work...but nothing that JoyToKey couldn't fix, lol). The game is a lot of fun, and I actually like the cheesy voice acting, as it is so 90s (or 80s...or 70s, lol) and just feels right at home.

24779808.review:
Very fun and challenging arcade style, fast paced shooter, presented in a 90's SNES visual style.  Bot Vice contains about 25 stages. Each level plays out on a single screen where you battle waves of robots until you reach the mini-boss battle at the end. Eventually leading up to the main story boss battles that progress the story line of the game. Some of the more hilarious bosses include parodies of Bebop and Rocksteady, as a bit of a TMNT fan tribute. The game also now features easy and hard mode. With the main difference being you receive health item drops while playing on easy difficulty. 

The game can be a bit tough at times but with a bit of practice it's possible to overcome. You're not only trying to just complete each stage but also race to obtain the best time possible. In order to stop the plot you're only given a set amount of time to complete the game. It becomes fairly important to keep your level completion times as low as possible.

The voice acting and long winded villain speeches add a bit of charm, as a loving reference to all the awesome and silly arcade sounds of old. The music is not bad and it contains some decent sound effects and a few silly voice lines. Music wise nothing incredible. It works well for what it's meant to be at least. 

The controls are very responsive, although the lock on system can be a little tricky at times. The power ups can also be a little tricky to cycle through. 

Theoretically the game is fairly short. But it still took me about 3-4 hours of actual playtime on easy mode to finally complete the game. It also gives you alot of achievements to shoot for which adds some replay-ability. I would say you're probably looking at 3-6 hours of playtime if you're as bad as I am at shooters, plus maybe another 1-2 hours if you're going for all the achievements. 

To sum it up, I really enjoyed playing this game and felt a real sense of accomplishment and excitement after finally kicking the final boss in his arse! If you're looking for some classic arcade action that offers a good challenge at a fairly cheap price I'd highly recommend giving Bot Vice a try.

24507928.review:
- El renacimiento del Gallery Shooter - 

Posiblemente le falten algunos elementos para ser un "Cabal" puro, pero ya dentro de su extraña mezcla, resulta uno de los mejores juegos de su género (si no el mejor para mi). El videojuego nos propone rodar, cubrirse y disparar a mansalva a un montón de bots rebeldes, que no nos lo pondrán nada sencillo. Para ello, disponemos de 6 armas distintas y la espada, que servirá para abatir a aquellos enemigos que estén más cerca de la barrera. Su brutal dificultad puede ser un impedimento para muchos, y es que, hay algunas cosas que podrían mejorarse para facilitar la tarea (más abajo lo especifico). El uso de las coberturas es muy bueno, me gusta bastante cómo hay que utilizarlas. Otro aspecto notable son los patrones de los jefes, originales y divertidos a rabiar.

Una música que me ha enamorado, sobre todo esas que sonaban tan funky, preciosas. Unos gráficos cuidados hasta el extremo, donde todo está animado; cada enemigo, cada elemento del escenario, cada uno de sus ataques... Uno de los mejores trabajos en pixel-art que se haya hecho en España, imperdible, dignos de elogio.

25 fases llenas de adrenalina, cada fase con un jefe y 5 grandes jefazos en medio de la aventura, qué, por cierto; tiene una historia bastante buena e interesante. Para el que ame los beat 'em ups, esa historia le puede gustar. Buenas actuaciones en inglés y divertidos diálogos.

En resumen; un híbrido entre shmup y gallery que destaca. A continuación propongo unas mejoras que creo que deben estar:

24469308.review:
Pros:

Fun gameplay
Good voice acting
Feels very much like an arcade game

Cons:

The level design should introduce levels gradulally increasing their difficulty so the player can learn and improve early skills before needing to learn new skills, or master old ones. The second level of the game introduces: an enemy that can hit you in cover, a vehicle that gives enemies in it much more life and acts as a barrier after it's destroyed, and an enemy that catches you off gaurd and quickly fires at you when dashing onto screen. This is too much to handle on only level two (about 5-10 minutes into the game).

I do recommend the game because it still feels very good to play, and if you die, it's because you aren't good enough. But, even with easy mode, the game expects the player to know all of nuances in the controls and be able to handle several new enemy types at once.

24264326.review:
[h1]This is my first impressions after the first hour of play[/h1]

Well, they weren't kidding when they said this game is bloody hard. It took me almost an hour just to beat the first stage alone. When it comes to games similar to Bot Vice, this is the closest game we have to Wild Guns on the PC as of today with a cover system and auto aim instead of manual aim because of the enemy bullets traveling as fast as your bullets instead of the usual travel speed of most bullet hell shooters which is fairly slow to say the least. Honestly the voice acting so far gives me a "take it or leave it" vibe since I find it pretty cheesy in my opinion. 

As far as I can tell, you cannot rebind the keyboard controls and instead gives you 2 presets for you, but they constantly push the notion that the game is best played with a controller not only on the store page, but also the splash screen saying " Winners don't use keyboards". Despite the recommended control schemes, it's playable with a keyboard. Enemies are greatly varied and all have distinct attack patterns that are easily identifiable from one another. I would say the only negative thing I can say about Bot Vice is that the difficulty curve is extremely high meaning if you don't have the patience to get better, the difficulty will turn you off completely.

Bot Vice is geared towards the masochistic and for anyone looking for a Wild Guns game on the PC, but mainly the masochistic all for the low price of $10.

24264062.review:
Simple arcade-style game with great visual and sound design.
My only gripe is its difficulty, which can only be described as "excessive" by modern standards.
You will likely die during the tutorial, which is the game's fault, not yours.
It simply doesn't give you enough time to learn, before it tries to absolutely murder you with lightning fast bullets coming from various directions.
I am not at all against difficult games, but the pacing seems off.
Stage 1 is pretty brutal, and it only gets worse from there.
If you think "Oh, all these people probably just suck", expect a nice, painful reality check when you first launch this game. It's a trial by fire, and you're going to die. A lot.

I feel the developer could have done a better job at easing people in by providing a couple of slower/easier stages until players get the hang of the game's controls and mechanics. We didn't get to play the game as much as you did, so please cut us some slack, alright?

If you're more into slow-paced, casual experiences, I don't think this game is for you.
It's fast, relentless, and it'll probably put you off within minutes.

Regardless of my criticism, the game does not deserve a negative mark just for that.
It certainly has its audience, and the rest of us will just have to "git gud".
Whether or not people will put up with it is a different story though.

39326455.review:
So I didn't realize this until the cameo at the beginning of Bot Vice, but DYA Games also made another shooter I own and had fun with, Super Star Path. I mention this because Bot Vice accomplishes as well what Super Star Path did before it: offering a satisfying arcade style shooting experience.

BV is simple in its design: move along the bottom of the screen dodging enemy attacks while shooting upwards at every enemy that appears on-screen. A wide variety of weapons, enemy types, level designs, and bosses gives BV a great sense of variety. It's fast-paced with a decent challenge: BV took me about an hour and a half to finish in my first sitting, so there's  a fair amount of length to the game, not even considering the dozens of extra missions and stage challenges.

I won't mention the story too much because it's an arcade game: it's not meant to be deep. The added voice acting is a campy touch, and the dialogue was appropriately dorky, but I mostly skipped through it. 

The sprite work is fantastic, the graphics vibrant and colorful, with a very good frame rate to back it up. The music is solid and the game handles well.

If you're willing to bulldog your way through some spots of diffuclty sprinkled throughout you'll find a very enjoyable shooter waiting for you.

Oh, and this may seem a little out of left field, but I'm very happy DYA Games decided not to include profanity in Bot Vice as they did in Super Star Path. There's a time and a place for adult content and an arcade style, 16-bit shooter is not one of them. So thank you, DYA Games, for taking the high road. Thumbs up.

39234143.review:
Bot Vice è senz'altro uno degli acquisti del 2017 appena passato di cui vado più fiero. Comprato al prezzo irrisorio di eurocent 49 (quarantanove!), onestamente le mie aspettative non erano propriamente alle stelle: sappiamo tutti che in questa fascia di prezzo - una terra di nessuno in cui la fregatura è sempre dietro l'angolo - ciofeche amatoriali e sòle incomplete trovano il proprio habitat ideale.  

E invece, con sommo stupore (e non poca soddisfazione) realizzo subito di avere tra le mani uno shooter arcade divertentissimo, frenetico e colorato, in grado di catapultarmi con violenza ai tempi in cui il SNES regnava sovrano e ci coccolava il palato con titoli come Wilds Guns. Non cito questo nome a caso: si da il caso che lo shooter di Natsume sia approdato recentemente su Steam in una versione "Reloaded", ampliata e "rimasterizzata"... per la modica (?) somma di 19.90 euro. Per quanto Wild Guns Reloaded sia senz'altro un gioco eccezionale (ammetto di andare sulla fiducia: sono fermo all'originale), facendo per una volta una considerazione di carattere economico il paragone con Bot Vice non regge minimamente: sul piano del rapporto qualità/prezzo e durata/prezzo il titolo di DYA Games sbaraglia la concorrenza vincendo a mani bassissime.

Nella storia vestiremo i panni di Erin Saver, agente di polizia che ha perso il proprio compagno (e il braccio destro, sostituito da un'arma bionica) per mano dei WildBots. Spinti dalla sete di vendetta dovremo farci largo attraverso diverse decine di scenari, cercando di sopravvivere ai proiettili nemici con l'onnipresente dodge-roll e utilizzando a mo' di scudo ripari di vario genere; in ogni scenario dovremo affrontare e sconfiggere un mini-boss per proseguire, mentre un boss più impegnativo ci aspetterà al termine di ogni sezione.

Nella pagina del negozio di Bot Vice avrete senz'altro notato la scritta a caratteri cubitali "Nota: A controller is strongly recommended to play this game"; il concetto verrà ribadito nella schermata iniziale che recita "Winners don't use keyboards", scimmiottando gli slogan anti-droga presenti in diversi titoli arcade degli anni '90. Fidatevi del consiglio: non sognatevi nemmeno di scaricare il gioco senza aver recuperato il fidato pad XBONE/X360. Ovviamente in line teorica il gioco sarebbe approcciabile anche con la tastiera, ma a meno che non siate una piovra, un pianista o un parlamentare italiano (c'è differenza?) vi assicuro che lo schema di controlli risulterebbe troppo ostico da padroneggiare alla perfezione.

Anche con il supporto di un buon pad, i controlli inizialmente risulteranno più complicati di quanto sarebbe lecito aspettarsi da un titolo simile. Qualcuno storcerà il naso nel constatare che Bot Vice NON è un twin stick shooter: infatti lo stick destro NON verrà utilizzato per il puntamento, che viene invece gestito con un apposito tasto dorsale e non è libero, ma salta da un bersaglio all'altro, favorendo inizialmente quello più vicino. Una volta metabolizzato lo schema di controlli - tra coperture, schivate, attacchi da mischia, cambio armi e chi più ne ha più ne metta - il gioco scorre che è un piacere.

Pixel-art e OST sono di ottimo livello ma soprattutto risultano estremamente fedeli al periodo di riferimento: pensandoci bene, è quasi un peccato che un gioco del genere sia uscito nei 201X e non negli anni '90 - sarebbe diventato istantaneamente un cult, su ogni piattaforma possibile e immaginabile. Il destino beffardo ha voluto che così non fosse, io dal canto mio faccio spallucce e me lo godo hic et nunc, al costo di mezzo caffè. 

Insomma, non tutti i mali vengono per nuocere.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1196612915

39206818.review:
This is a quite good and hard retro arcade shmup in the style of Wild Guns. You can only move left and right on the bottom of the screen and you have to shoot the baddies that move around on the top while dodging and blocking incoming fire. Visuals are pretty good and clear pixel graphics and while there's usually a lot going on with shooting and explosions and multiple enemies, it's relatively easy to keep track of what's going on. The game isn't very long, but the stages are pretty challenging and there are achievements for doing some stages in a certain way, so there should be enough content for the low price this game has.

Get this game if you want some simple but hard arcade shooting with lots of explosions and relentless waves of enemies.

39196476.review:
I've been holding off writing a review for a little while, since I wanted to finish the game. Bot Vice is a rather difficult gallery shooter, where you control Erin the protagonist in her quest to avenge the death of her partner. It is a simple plot, but it gives the gameplay a purpose, and that is where the meat of the game is. Explosions and bullets are everywhere! You need to be good at crowd control, or you'll easily be overwhelmed in the later stages. The game just feels really good to play, due to the flawless (in my opinion) controls, well-designed hitboxes, and tight movement of your character. I never felt like a died because of clunky movement or cheap hitboxes. You move almost immediately and turn on a dime, which is required in a game like this. There are plenty of stages, and each stage has its own music track. The music is fantastic, the sprite work is equally excellent, the sound effects are really good too. There is also some nice screenshake that makes the weapons feel even more powerful, but you can dial that down if you wish. My only complaints are: The voice acting is pretty hit-and-miss (I don't expect amazing voice acting from indie studios anyways) and it can kind of grate on you after awhile. Secondly, I found little to no use for the cover system. I beat the entire game without touching cover at all. In my opinion, if you just keep moving and roll to avoid shots, you'll be fine. The only time this isn't viable is in a few stages which essentially require you to use your Sabre to stay alive. (it is a melee attack that hits enemies and destroys bullets on contact) overall this is a really fun retro shooter that I enjoyed from start to finish. The devs are also really active in my experience, and very friendly too.

Whether you get it on sale for $1 like I did, or pay full price, it's worth it. The amount of work that went into the sprite animations and music is pretty insane. Support indie developers like DYA Games, they know what they're doing. They've become one of my favorite up and coming developers, and I can't wait to see what's down the pipeline for them in the future.

39187299.review: Bot Vice is a sort of retro, arcadey shooting gallery thing, with lots of powerful weapons and wacky bosses, where you die and respawn with the same speed and frequency as Hotline Miami. The difficulty curve's basically a plateau with a normal curve on top of it, so frustration should abound, but for some reason it doesn't bother me at all; when I die, I just calmly hit restart and dive back into the welcoming sound and fury, and try to roll more this time. 39183542.review:
Very fun game. It's a bit short, but I think it's the perfect length, especially for the price you can get it for. There are 25 story mode stages and 25 extra stages. Each stage takes between 1-2 minutes, although you're likely to die a few times on levels. All in all, it takes a bit under 2 hours to beat, maybe more if you're not too great at chaotic action games, and if you're looking for your money's worth, you can get it with the challenges (rankings and beating stages with 4 hearts) and extra stages.

I won't talk about gameplay much. The videos speak for themselves. I'll just say it's fun and rewarding, and it's actually more chaotic than the videos let on. Each stage is unique and has its own gimmick with tons of enemy variety, so levels never feel the same. I only have two minor gripes with the game: weapon powerups and taking cover.

Your default gun has unlimited ammo but isn't special in any way, but you frequently get powerups that have limited ammo. The problem with them is only two are complete upgrades to the default weapon, and 3 others are very situational (one is short range, one is slow but powerful, the other is... slow but powerful). But you switch between the 6 possible weapons with one button in real time, so it's hard to 1. see if you even have the ammo that you want and 2. quickly and efficiently switch to that ammo type. I wish holding it would pause the game and bring up a weapon wheel or something.

As for taking cover, my gripe with it is it seems kind of useless. It seems like a big feature of gameplay with your cover being destructible even, but dashing seems superior in 95% of the time, so those times that you might actually benefit from cover instead of dashing, your instinct is to dash. I wish the game was built around possibly punishing dashing or something else to encourage use of the cover mechanic, which seems unique.

Minor gripes and short length aside, this game is fun and feels unique, so I recommend you pick it up.

Also, one note. While the game claims to be ball-bustingly hard, I never felt it to be super hard (well the final level definitely took me the most retries). But that's apparently because difficulty levels were added after release. The original difficulty is hard, so playing on normal does not actually reflect the developer's original vision, but it likely made it more enjoyable to a wider audience. That addition added some quirks, such as not differentiating between hard and easy as far as level time (which is recorded) goes. The game has level rankings and even requires you beat all of the stages under a set amount of time (45 minutes I think? And time is based on your fastest run) to unlock the final level, but on normal difficulty, I got A rank on almost all stages without trying, and I reached the final level with 10 minutes to spare.
