39134975.review:
This is one of the finest retro action games on Steam, no less.

As you could see by watching the store gameplay videos, this game comes with top-notch pixel art and FM-like synth music, all in fair amounts: I think the base 25 stages (1 stage is supposed to run about 1 minute if you don't die) all have distinct scenery and music. The game comes with 35 extra stages (I think these do reuse assets and music, they may have extract content though, I have not played all of them yet).

The gameplay is equally good imho. This is a "simple" cover-based gallery shooter. What can be less obvious is that:
- you can move slowly behind the covers
- ennemies can damage and eventually destroy the covers that you overuse
- there is a very useful dash move that provides invincibility frames (from start to end, this might sound like it is too much but abusing it is risky)
- you can *seamlessly* switch between cover and dash
- you can cancel out bullets by hitting in front of you (with what looks like a sword but is Erin's arm I think ?), also very useful
- ennemies come with all kind of attacks. Most will simply shoot towards you, but a few will reach you above your cover, set the ground on fire, etc. etc.
- you can shoot in front of you or lock to the nearest ennemy (no analog in this game). You can keep locking an ennemy far away on purpose or re-lock to the nearest ennemy. The lock system works pretty overall, it is simple enough not to distract you from dodging / covering.
- there are additionnal weapons (they use limited ammo), you can switch weapons back and forth anytime.

Overall, the moveset feels pretty good and work well with the game, ennemies and bullets patterns.

Each stage comes with its own mini-boss(es). Most (all ?) of them are unique.

The only negative to me would be:
- it is really, really hard to "accurately" switch between weapons, even after the update that added the ability to switch weapons 2-way (using 2 buttons). I think there may still be more ways to make it a bit easier. Anyway, it is no big deal because the game almost never *requires* you to switch very fast to a specific weapon at a specific moment
- the time constraint may not be severe enough. I had plenty of time left even in hard mode. To be honest, I think this is because I play too risky.
- the game could track progress a bit better (by difficulty settings). There is a reason for that: initially the game did not feature difficulty modes. Since many people found the game too hard, the devs eventually set three difficulty modes (current hard mode is like previous default). Hard is perfectly manageable if you are into arcadey difficulty though, I have beaten games that I think are much harder (namely Dustforce and Cloudbuilt).
- as you can see, only very minor "issues" (I can think only of one or two more). Everything else is perfect !

39112710.review:
This is a hard one for me, but despite enjoying the game, I'm going to have to recommend against Bot Vice. What it comes down to is 'too much'. There's too much going on each round to be able to have a plan for each round. Bullets come from everywhere and coat your side of the field, guaranteeing that you're going to take hits when trying to fight back. Many enemies have little to no telegraphs (thankfully the mortar ones do), with at least one enemy type [i]coming out shooting at you[/i] if he spawns in while you're on the edge of the screen. So god damn much that it's not worth reading the screen, and instead just taking cover and rolling until you can get to a spot where you can shoot.

The aiming mechanic is bad also. It initially locks on to the closest enemy and sticks, but that might not be your intended target, and if it is then slashing or ducking will relock onto a nearby target. This is a game that could desperately use mouse support for proper aiming, but the developer is one who takes pride in mocking KBM players, so that's a thing. Frankly, moving to where you need to shoot straight ahead is far better than holding the aim button.

It's not a bad game presentation-wise, and it feels like there's meat to be had if the level and enemy design was better managed. The sheer amount of projectiles on screen turns the game into duck, roll, and shoot, with controlled weapon switching for when mooks and bosses are out. That's it. It's mindless fun, sure, but that alone isn't worth a recommendation, and the aiming thing brings the game down into a recommendation [i]against[/i].

39082369.review:
Ok, I recommend this game , especially for the price you can get it at on sale. But, with some serious reservations, see my pros and cons.

Pros:

Level design is exceptional
Manages to be original with gameplay despite an increasingly crowded genre
Graphics/sound/all other bells and whistles are very nice

Cons:

Level of difficulty is in the "so hard it's no longer fun" realm (except at the very beginning)
-- My biggest problem with this is the way the creators accomplished this. They either add environmental elements that are entirely random (i.e., eliminates the actual challenge of a platformer which is muscle memory and makes it largely about chance), or by making your character almost impossible to control. The ladder is kind of fun IF YOU LIKE THAT KIND OF THING, the former almost made me not recommend the game.

This is only a platformer by a VERY loose definition, all the later levels involve significant modifications to control and environment that mean most of the time you are not jumping from platform to platform.

Bot Vice é um jogo de ação com uma temática cyberpunk, lembra bastante os games dos consoles antigos, como nintendinho, mega drive, etc.

O jogo tem uma história simples, nada de incrivel, mais não deixa a desejar.

O sistema de conquistas também é bem legal.

O jogo não é fácil, então se for jogar, prepare-se pra gastar um tempinho bom e passar um pouquinho de raiva kkkk.

Minha nota para o game é : 10/10, simplesmente muito bom !!

39470304.review:
Para ser un juego sensillo, barato, Indie y arcaico, pues, termina siendo extremadamente adicitvo. 
 No solo por esa sensacion de furor que te da, por dispararle a todo lo que se mueva y destruir el 90% del escenario, si no por lo bien implementado de sus mecanicas y su dificultad, algo elevada, pero entretenida.
 Digo, si tienes mas de 3 metodos para destruir/evadir los proyectiles enemigos, tanto sea, cortandolos con tu sable y matando a algunos a la misma vez, pero quedando mas vulnerable, o poniendote a cubierto, pero con el peligro de que el entorno que te protege sea facilmente destruido y/o, directamente, esquivando todo con una voltereta. Aun asi, se dificulta todo, por la gran cantidad de proyectiles que se encuentran en pantalla y que algunos me resultan (en lo personal) imposibles de evadir, no tanto como un Bullethell cualquiera, tanto sea Touhou como Cuphead, pero es aceptable.
 +Los escenarios son muy dinamicos y variopintos. Pasando por una carretera meramente transitada, Ciudades llenas de basura o Estaciones de metro en donde puedes empujar a los enemigos para ejecutarlos, hasta interiores de edificios Empresariales. 
 +El Pixel art, es muy bueno. Todos los entornos y enemigos, estan bien sincronizados.
 +Los efectos de sonido son muy buenos y se siente la potencia del audio bien optimizado, al usar tus armas. Pero los actores de voz....Meh.
 -La musica es decente, pero olvidable.
 -La historia, simplona y Gliche, pero es perdonable ante un juego que solo esta dedicado a la accion pura y dura. 
 
 9/10. Obligatorio para cualquiera que sea Nostalfag o solo quiera pasar un rato ¨casual¨.
